text:
Chief Complaint:  hypotension
   HPI:
   70yo f w SCLC, DMII/HTN/Hyperlipidemia, afib on coumadin, ESRD 2'
   previous cisplatin therapy, transferred to unit for hypotension.
   .
   Hosp course initially p/w SOB and found to have large right pleural
   effusion.  Tapped (transudative on [**6-25**]).  On [**7-13**], had right mainstem
   bronch stent placed.  This was c/b hypoxic resp failure and need for
   intubation.  She was in the ICU and underwent [**Initials (NamePattern4) **] [**Last Name (NamePattern4) **] on [**7-14**] (900cc
   removed).  She tolerated this well and was sent to the East floors.
   This week c/b rising WBC and concerns for postob PNA.  Recently started
   on vanco and levaquin to treat for PNA and patient remained stable on
   floor.  Over last 3d has had constipation and increasing abd pain.  Rx
   at one point with manual disimpaction w success.
   .
   Today, she had increased abd pain.  lactate was 2.6.  CT abd showed
   ileus but no acute mesenteric stranding or ischemia.  CT abd showed RLL
   consolidation with effusion.  Tonight at 7pm, had acute worsening abd
   pain and found to have SBP 60s (down from baseline 90-100).  Pt had
   decreased ms and poor access so HD line was used for 1.3 L bolus.  SBP
   improved to 110
   In MICU, art line confirmed SBP 90-110.  Abd pain persisted and was
   largely relieved by manual disimpaction.
   Hypotension (not Shock)
   Assessment:
   Manual bp variable, 70-90s.
   Action:
   2L NS x2 given during transfer, aline placed.  Additional 500cc NS
   bolus given
   Response:
   Abp 90s-110s
   Plan:
   Cont to monitor bp. Bolus PRN. Aline positional.
   Constipation (Obstipation, FOS)
   Assessment:
   Abdom firm, c/o [**10-27**] pain.  CT showed ileus.
   Action:
   Lactulose given, manual disimpaction x2, fleets enema given. NGT
   attempted, mushroom cath placed.
   Response:
   Small amount of stool removed from disimpacting. No response from
   lactulose and enema. Pt vomited when NGT placement attempt. Moderate
   relief emesis and disimpation.
   Plan:
   ?NGT placement, disimpacted PRN.
   Neuro: alert and oriented. c/o [**10-27**] abdominal pain. Pain meds held r/t
   unstable bp. Afebrile (bld cx sent).
   Resp: NC 2L, LSC diminished at bases.
   CV: sbp 90s-110s, total of 2.5LNS bloused. NSR-ST, converted to afib
   150s-160s during NGT attempt. 5mg metoprololx2 given.
   GI/GU: anuric, HD Tues/Thurs/Sat. constipated, mushroom cath placed.
